title: Model A Discrete Random Variable
text: We can model a custom discrete random variable using the rv_discrete class in SciPy.stats.

title: Model A Discrete Random Variable
text:
Example
Let \(X\) be a discrete random variable with p.m.f.,



\(x\)
0
1
2
3




\(p(x)\)
0.4
0.15
0.1
0.35



Import rv_discrete.

from scipy.stats import rv_discrete

Initialise xs and ps, the event space and the probability of an event occurring.

xs = tuple([*range(4)])      # event space
ps = (0.4, 0.15, 0.1, 0.35)  # p(event)

Initialise the random variable.

x = rv_discrete(values=(xs, ps))

Check that x has initialised as expected.

assert x.mean() == 1.4
assert all(x.pmf(xs) == ps)
print('Test complete.')

Test complete.
